semantic_title: COVID-19 Infection Coding in Pregnancy, Childbirth, and Puerperium
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 15. Chapter 15: Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperium > s. COVID-19 infection in pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium

content.full_text: During pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium, when COVID-19 is the reason for admission/encounter, code O98.5-, Other viral diseases complicating pregnancy, childbirth and the puerperium, should be sequenced as the principal/first-listed diagnosis, and code U07.1, COVID-19, and the appropriate codes for associated manifestation(s) should be assigned as additional diagnoses. Codes from Chapter 15 always take sequencing priority. If the reason for admission/encounter is unrelated to COVID-19 but the patient has been diagnosed with COVID-19 during the admission/encounter, the appropriate code for the reason for admission/encounter should be sequenced as the principal/first-listed diagnosis, and codes O98.5- and U07.1, as well as the appropriate codes for associated COVID-19 manifestations, should be assigned as additional diagnoses. (Evidence: pg no: 71, L64-L69)
content.summary: COVID-19 in pregnancy uses O98.5- as principal when COVID is reason for encounter, or as additional when incidental. Chapter 15 codes always take sequencing priority. (Evidence: pg no: 71, L64-L69)
key_concepts: Chapter 15 sequencing priority (Evidence: pg no: 71, L67)
COVID-19 as reason for encounter vs incidental (Evidence: pg no: 71, L64-L65, L67-L68)
Dual coding with O98.5- and U07.1 (Evidence: pg no: 71, L65-L66)
Associated manifestation coding (Evidence: pg no: 71, L66, L68-L69)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use O98.5- as principal when COVID-19 is reason for admission in pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 71, L64-L66)
detailed_rules.explanation: When COVID-19 is the primary reason for admission during pregnancy, childbirth, or puerperium, code O98.5- as principal diagnosis, followed by U07.1 and manifestation codes (Evidence: pg no: 71, L64-L66)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use O98.5- as additional when COVID-19 is incidental to admission (Evidence: pg no: 71, L67-L69)
detailed_rules.explanation: When the reason for admission is unrelated to COVID-19 but patient has COVID-19, sequence the primary reason first, then add O98.5-, U07.1, and manifestation codes (Evidence: pg no: 71, L67-L69)
common_applications: Labor and delivery with incidental COVID

detailed_rules.rule_text: Codes from Chapter 15 always take sequencing priority (Evidence: pg no: 71, L67)
detailed_rules.explanation: Chapter 15 codes have priority over other codes when coding pregnancy-related encounters, including COVID-19 cases (Evidence: pg no: 71, L67)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Determine if COVID-19 is reason for encounter or incidental
Step 2: If COVID is primary reason, use O98.5- as principal
Step 3: If COVID is incidental, use primary reason first
Step 4: Add U07.1 as additional diagnosis
Step 5: Add manifestation codes as appropriate

code_ranges.description: Other viral diseases complicating pregnancy, childbirth and the puerperium (Evidence: pg no: 71, L65-L66)
code_ranges.requirement: Required for COVID-19 in pregnancy cases
usage_rules: Principal when COVID is reason for encounter (Evidence: pg no: 71, L65-L66)
Additional when COVID is incidental (Evidence: pg no: 71, L68-L69)

specific_codes.context: Always used as additional diagnosis with O98.5- in pregnancy

code_patterns.description: Standard pattern for COVID-19 in pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 71, L65-L66)
code_patterns.example: O98.5- as principal, U07.1 and pneumonia code as additional
code_patterns.explanation: Captures pregnancy context, COVID diagnosis, and specific manifestations

coding_scenarios.scenario: Pregnant patient admitted primarily for COVID-19 pneumonia
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: 28-week pregnant patient admitted with COVID-19 pneumonia requiring oxygen therapy.
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify COVID-19 as primary reason for admission
Step 2: Code O98.5- as principal diagnosis
Step 3: Add U07.1 as additional diagnosis
Step 4: Add pneumonia code as manifestation

correct_coding.sequencing: O98.5- principal, U07.1 and manifestations additional
correct_coding.rationale: When COVID-19 is reason for admission in pregnancy, O98.5- is principal with U07.1 and manifestations as additional (Evidence: pg no: 71, L64-L66)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Chapter 15 codes take priority over COVID codes
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using U07.1 as principal instead of O98.5-

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient in labor with incidental COVID-19 diagnosis
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient presents in active labor at term. Routine COVID testing positive but asymptomatic.
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify labor as primary reason for admission
Step 2: Code delivery as principal diagnosis
Step 3: Add O98.5- as additional diagnosis
Step 4: Add U07.1 as additional diagnosis

correct_coding.sequencing: Delivery code principal, O98.5- and U07.1 additional
correct_coding.rationale: When COVID is incidental, primary reason is principal with O98.5- and U07.1 as additional (Evidence: pg no: 71, L67-L69)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Labor/delivery is the primary reason, not COVID
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Making COVID primary when it's incidental to delivery

warnings: Chapter 15 codes always take sequencing priority (Evidence: pg no: 71, L67)
best_practices: Always use both O98.5- and U07.1 for COVID in pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 71, L65-L66, L68-L69)
Include manifestation codes when present (Evidence: pg no: 71, L66, L68-L69)
common_mistakes: Using U07.1 as principal when COVID is primary reason
tips: Determine if COVID is primary reason or incidental to guide sequencing
implementation_notes: Ensures proper documentation of COVID impact on pregnancy
clinical_context: Important for tracking COVID effects on maternal and fetal health
